officer
  • Powerpoint
  • Word
  • Function reference

open a connexion to a 'Word' file

read and import a docx file as an R object representing the document.

read_docx(path = NULL)

# S3 method for rdocx
print(x, target = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for rdocx
length(x)

Arguments

path
path to the docx file to use a base document.
x
a rdocx object
target
path to the docx file to write
...
unused

Examples

# create a rdocx object with default template ---
read_docx()
#> rdocx document with 2 element(s)
#> Available styles are:
#>    style_type             style_name
#> 1   paragraph                 Normal
#> 2   paragraph              heading 1
#> 3   paragraph              heading 2
#> 4   paragraph              heading 3
#> 5   character Default Paragraph Font
#> 6       table           Normal Table
#> 7   numbering                No List
#> 8   character                 strong
#> 9   paragraph               centered
#> 10      table         table_template
#> 11      table    Light List Accent 2
#> 12  character            Titre 1 Car
#> 13  character            Titre 2 Car
#> 14  character            Titre 3 Car
#> 15  paragraph          graphic title
#> 16  paragraph            table title
#> 17      table     Table Professional
#> 18  paragraph                  toc 1
#> 19  paragraph                  toc 2
#> 20  paragraph           Balloon Text
#> 21  character    Texte de bulles Car

# write a rdocx object in a docx file ----
if( require(magrittr) && has_zip() ){
  read_docx() %>% print(target = "out.docx")
  # full path of produced file is returned
  print(.Last.value)
}

# how many element are there in the document ----
length( read_docx() )
#> [1] 2
